JobFullDesc: The EO Mechanical Design Department Manager(DM) will be responsible to effectively lead a product oriented mechanical design department of approximately 150 engineers, designers and technicians. The department is located in El Segundo, CA and the DM’s home office will be in El Segundo, CA and reports under the Hardware Engineering Center Space Systems Mission Area.  This position provides technical leadership for the design, analysis, development and production of EO/IR Sensor subsystems for military and domestic and foreign government systems. This role is the top level decision making interface between the product line customers, programs, other functions and the EO Sensor Design Department. The DM ensures effective bidding and execution for proposals, design, development, and production support efforts. This position is accountable for providing high integrityengineering products/services and continuously driving the department’s technical skills, executionand staffing levels in order to provide the required innovation and efficiency, effectiveness, capabilityand capacity to meet Raytheon Intelligence and Space RIS) business needs. This includes continually developing design best practices and training.This role will provide technical and functional leadership to the organization including, effectivedeployment of process initiatives and growth and maintenance of department capabilities for development andmanufacture of sensor subsystems. This role will be responsible for managing labor and non-labor budgets to meet organizational funding targets. This role will be engaged in gate reviews, proposal development, design/peer/independent reviews and cost and schedule of efforts performed by their organization.Program responsibilities also include providing leadership for development/management of subsystem engineering, design, execution of trade studies, interface definition/management, verification/test planning, and integration. The department manager will also be accountable for performance management including organizational and individual goal setting, career counseling, and employee development which are aligned to product roadmaps and resource allocation.The Department Manager Responsibilities include:Coaching, guidance and direction to Section Managers on performance management, career development & training, and resource allocation. The department manager is responsible for leading the department in the execution of the Center and RIS Engineering goals. The department manager will be engaged across all S&C2 business areas to ensure that all aspects of hardware development are addressed.Required Skills:• 12 plus years in mechanical or optical engineering, including leadership roles• Thorough knowledge of the department’s products and technologies.• Detailed knowledge of bidding processes and proposal development• Working knowledge of EVMS, IMS, & IMP tools for managing programs.
